chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact or Sexual Intercourse w/ Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pu Gray

records.addlTxt: Forthwith Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Pu Gray appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Pu Gray.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Bellows in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn Karen Interpreter: Len Bathin.
Case in court for Return of Doctor's Report.  State and Defense have received and reviewed the report.  No challenges to the report.
Court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed but will become competent within the Case in court for return on doctors report.   Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report. 
Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   
Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility FORTHWITH.  
Case is adjourned to 1-3-23 at 9:00 am for a Return on Doctor's Report review hearing.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed and filed.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Pu Gray not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court for Pu Gray.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Case is scheduled for return of doctor's report on today's date.
Defense counsel must schedule an interpreter to review the report with defendant; that review is scheduled for October 7, 2022.
Discussion with the parties as to availability of interpreter and further, court will not be in session the week of October 10, 2022.

Court orders case adjourned for return of doctor's report in Branch 28.
Parties prefer to transition to the doctor's report hearing as soon as possible after defense counsel has completed her review with defendant.

Clerk:  jms
from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated September 19, 2022 - received
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Pu Gray in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court for Pu Gray.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court is in receipt of a letter from examining physician requesting adjournment as they have not yet been able to conduct examination due to language and scheduling interpretation.
Court orders case adjourned for return of doctor's report in Branch 28.

Court Interpreter Coordinator to be notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
Sworn as Karen interpreter:   Priscilla Patrick Aungy, appearing via Zoom video
Competency Evaluation Extension Letter, filed. Forwarded to the judge for review.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Pu Gray not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Interpreter not present in court.

Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Case is scheduled for scheduling conference on today's date.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant examined by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  
Order for Competency Examination to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 28.

Court Interpreter Coordinator notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms

Defense counsel contacted the court to request an earlier hearing date.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Milwaukee County Court Interpreter Coordinator contacted as to availability of interpreter.
Case is rescheduled for hearing in Branch 28 on August 3, 2022.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Pu Gray in court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons; both appear by video.  Defendant Pu Gray in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Mulania Bathin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Zolo.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Pu Gray in court, appear by video with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons, appear by video.  Defendant Pu Gray in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Sandaw Aye.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Fitzsimmons needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
For reasons stated through e-mail with attorney Fitzsimmons, case was rescheduled. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 6/14/22, at 1:30 pm. in Preliminary Hearing Court.
Sworn as interpreter: (KAREN) Htoo Paw.

Defendant Pu Gray in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed as a friend of the court.  Defendant Pu Gray in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing held. Defense informs the court that representation has not yet been appointed. For reasons stated on the record, SPD to provide counsel at the next court date for the purposes of the Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case calendared for Order to Show Cause Hearing May 2, 2022.  Court not in session on that date.  Parties agree via email to May 17, 2022 at 9:00 am.  bm

Defendant Pu Gray not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State v. Lee hearing (Order to show cause) in Branch 25.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pu Gray not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter: Cynas Hla.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
   99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Pu Gray not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness present in Court.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to adjourn hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMS, PE, VP, TM, AS
Sworn as interpreter: Cynas Hla (KAREN)

Defendant Pu Gray in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Pu Gray in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pu Gray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
